name: solobuttons
text: I LOVE those 3 guys.

text: So do i, if only for the fact that they show back up at Lyle's SaniTaco asking "Is... Is this where the lady sat on the counter?" and "Are... Is Lyle here?"

text: good call

text: Sex is philosophy, philosophy is sex.

text: Nomeansno is jammin'

name: saint
text:
...brilliant.

Sorry, it just struck me funny considering it's the only thing the guy in the middle says.

name: wittyname
text: You best re-read panel 4.

name: saint
text: holy jesus. i thought the guy on the far right said that, but I was clearly mistaken. at a second glance, my previous post is hereby rendered incorrect.

name: cjfoster
text: it looks like the three guys are just thinking most of it, except for the guy on the right in panel 5.

name: solobuttons
text: and now we know Nolan better, too

name: history
text: A comment left by history was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Afterward, trollcollins, idsyen, fmercury, jmmfgd, Appers)

name: stormagnet
text: On the other hand, if you deliberately deconstruct things that you *know* are dog-crap/boring in this fashion, you will always be entertained.

name: stormagnet
text: Bonus points if you can trick your professor into buying it.

name: aliiis
text: my boyfriend liked to do this with 80s action movies ( Predator, Total Recall et al) in film school.

name: tripleg
text: negative bonus points if you can't stop yourself from so doing anymore

name: idsyen
text: Thank God someone FINALLY had the guts to put those intellectuals in their place.

name: boredom_man
text: It's all correct of course, and behind it I could hear History begging me for a job.

name: history
text: A job?  Really?  For me?  Of course I need a job!  Its part of my motivation for pointing intellectual failings!  I had to settle for corporate america instead of intellectual freedom.  My post?  A cry for help...

name: fictions
text: Onstad is the Noam Chomsky of web comics.

name: singtralala
text: specially the one that says "brilliant" twice

name: hollis
text: Oh, art critics...

name: catachresis
text: Newsnight Review

name: honesttom
text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Every time I catch that pretentious heap of crap on TV, I think of this strip. Chubbied, sir.

name: gmm
text: It is my favorite piece of pretentious crap.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: what is pretentious is that tolerance index in The Onion. (i don't remember what it's called. 'the what we're sick of this week scale' or sominlidat)

name: iloveyoucupcake
text: Brilliant.

name: agika
text: I enjoy the fact that one of them thinks "Unremitting hilarity" while maintaining a face completely devoid of emotion.

name: chaesar
text: And of course two of them have beards.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Dang, why am I down here?

name: zedpower
text:
Maybe this is a metaphor for Achewood, and we are all these three guys. Onstad, why doth thou burn this candle at both ends?

...naaaah.

name: charchar
text:
inner grammar Nazi: shouldn't it be dost?
Me: Shutupshutup shutup!
inner grammar Nazi: Bitch, what did I tell you about stranding prepositions?

name: lizard
text: Fret not.  There's no art wanker like an art wanker who can't even get the lingo straight.

name: cdl146
text: My girlfriend is a music major, so I've run into about a dozen of these guys. The worst was the one who had about 15 people play one note for exactly 31 minutes and call it great art. I wish I were making this up.

name: audhumla
text: which note? this is important

name: terebikun
text: Better than "Silence" by John Cage.

name: bixschmix
text: There was an art project at my college where they dedicated a room to letting people make out... and it just became situation art. I never quite understood either the artistic or academic intent, to be honest, but maybe that's just me...

name: stormagnet
text: I'm pretty sure the intent was to get the college to sponser a room for the explicit purpose of make-outs. That is fucking BRILLIANT.

name: bixschmix
text: Did the twinge of sarcasm in my original comment not come across successfully? Damn internet...

name: tekende
text: That is so fucking stupid it actually makes me angry.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh God that pisses me off. I'm an art student and fairly liberal about these things, but that's so ridiculous. When I learnt about this, the lecturer was saying "So-and-so Orchestra played this at The Albert Hall", and I was just thinking "...no they didn't."

name: terebikun
text:
Have you ever watched a performance of it? I'm also an art student and fairly open-minded about what makes "art", and the best I can make of "4'33" is the audience's awkward/smug reactions, and the coughs and sneezes and sighs from them sort of becomes the music. It's still kind of bullshit though.

Even more ridiculous however, is how the estate of John Cage sued some musician for "infringing on copyrighted material" because the guy had a song of one minute of silence on his cd. The musician responded that his was the better piece, because he was able to say in one minute what Cage could only say in 4 minutes.

name: heccibiggs
text: Hahahaha I can't believe they actually sued for ownership of silence. Either way, they're both idiots.

name: atticusonline
text: heccibiggs is now my favorite achwoodteer.

name: i_love_kate
text: For agreeing with that guy? Is this a position that she holds to this day?

name: woodenteeth
text:
I've thought long and hard about weird, seemingly pointless art and I continually return to the conclusion that conceptual art should be kept conceptual. That if the "experience" of it is less than the "idea" then it should stay in some artists scrap book.

Unfortunately the idea of "less" can then be argued by any intellectual anywhere for at least too long for me to care anymore.

name: woodenteeth
text: (i.e. I really like the idea of "4'33''" but the experience of it is particularly bland and unmoving. Having people reflect on negative space however is awesome: I'm looking at you Mars Volta.

name: lizard
text: http://www.27bslash6.com/missy.html

name: ham_shoes
text: Coulda been worse. see: Spoken Word

name: gigs
text: As a possible music major, just the thought of people wanking to a single note drives me fucking crazy.

name: dreamerman91
text: brilliant. The fervent intellectual misconstrues meaning: the world rejoices

name: jesler729
text: Of the three of them, only the one on the right felt his thoughts were strong enough to say aloud.

name: equinn2006
text: I'm pretty sure that a two-way deadpan is no longer a joke.

name: cthulhu235
text: Ironically, there's way too many achewood fans who talk exactly like these guys.

name: yingkaixing
text: Most of us read this comment and think, "HA! Yes. That's not me, though." However, at least one person realized what a hollow shell he is and knew deep down that somehow you were referring specifically to him. He lamed you in his anger at you making such a personal criticism.

name: cthulhu235
text: He's probably Nolan from the Internet.

name: cthulhu235
text: For example, the dudes who posted on Emeril's discussion board back when he debuted his blog.

name: tropicana
text:
I was just thinking that maybe Onstad created these characters to parody the people that discuss his comic.

Could it be? Nah...

name: epicurus
text: As a person with a degree in philosophy, this strip is capable of bringing me to orgasm without any outside help.

name: ford
text:
I am inclined to point out that your grammar implies that the strip in question is a person with a degree in philosophy. Although to be fair, it does depict three people very likely to have said philosophy degrees.

Also i gave you a chubby to make up for my grammar Nazism and general pedantry.

name: epicurus
text: You're right, and my otherwise unremarkable comment becomes pretty hilarious when read that way.

name: dejavroom
text: ... and then Pat busts out ol' Daytripper intro. Pat, you're a dick ... This is indeed orgasmic.

name: stuart
text:
"th defining anti-vanity of the coming decade"

OHOHOHO was this guy in for a shock

name: gazdatronik
text: Pat is quoting Elvis in panel two.

name: isaach
text: is that... nolan?

name: quinlaenar
text: Yes, how observant of you.

name: nucleargeranium
text:
Hey, the guy on the far right is Nolan from the internet!

http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua7GBRWt

name: bartleby
text: Nolan seems like he's been in sort of a downward spiral over the last four years. I don't think he gets out much anymore, unless lured by the prospect of seeing his coffee symbolically penetrated by an unsanitary tiger.

name: wiliamthepleasr
text: There was nothing symbolic about that latte penetration.

name: quietwyatt
text: The one in the middle IS James Lipton.

name: soticoto
text: The one on the left is totally a Nietzsche clone.

name: wurstbruch
text: Sadly, it has to be said. The 2nd person singular of "do" was "doest" or "dost" not "doth". So asking Apollo would need "why do(e)st thou burn ...".

name: stormagnet
text: But the incorrect usage is so perfectly in character!

name: caseyb3
text:
I bet they're just there as the Main Perverts of the Internet, per the former arrangement with Achewood's cats. Nobody is paying these men to be here.

As a man of the academy I hear this shit all day long. Is SO good.

name: achilleselbow
text: The guy on the left is in my philosophy class and always tries to get in a smart-ass comment with a high nasally voice, I swear that's him, right there.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
bring him to mind.

bring him to mind and then murder him.

stab him in the face with a large knife. a fork.

make it as gruesome as possible.

then high five your monster and put it back in the closet.

you have just used an insane fantasy to keep you sane.

name: tekende
text: Wow, a JtHM reference. Awesome! Chubbied.

name: blotto
text: I usually use a spork in my insane fantasies...

name: snowman
text: I love those critics.  Those critics are awesome.  I would buy a shirt with those critics on it.

name: lizard
text: Two years later and I'm wondering why the hell this completely splendid idea hasn't been seized with two oversized metal fists by the Onstad marketing cyborg, sealed inside an iron ball and fired at the moon.  My all time favourite strip.

name: wilbur
text: This is one of the strips that has a weird connection with my life. When I was 11, my friend and I learned how to play the Day Tripper intro by ear in my school's guitar class. It ended up being the only thing I know how to play on the guitar to this day. If I was Pat in this situation, this is exactly the song I would go to.

name: subrosian
text: Everything was going wonderfully until someone mentioned Nietzsche.

name: envika
text: Onstad misspelled "exhilarating." Just being a pedant.

name: dasilodavi
text: These guys straight up creep me the fuck out.

name: genequagmire
text: This strip evokes a timeless struggle between classist tendencies and egalitarian yearning common to all synergies.

name: miku224
text: Oh god I want to give you a chubby AND a lame.

name: hyetal
text:
Why did these guys come here. It wasn't even going to be this.

No, they would've reacted the same way to anything.

I don't want to be these guys.

text: it's freakish how 'smart' Onstad is Engish, for how his cats talk mostly

text: DO YOU SPEAK IT?

name: stuart
text: You know, it's also possible he was trying to play Devo's "The 4th Dimension".
